Reviews.Content: To start off, My ex wife and I bought a Nikon P80, and I really liked that camera. Now on to this camera..... Size was not an Issue for me, but don't expect to put this camera in a pocket. More importantly, the pictures were grainy, the colors were off, and the camera was 100% automatic, so there was no way to adjust the picture quality. The final straw with me, was comparing pictures from my brand new Nikon Coolpix L100 10MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical zoom, to the pictures from my Kodak EasyShare CX7430 4MP Digital Camera with 3x optical zoom, that I bought in Early 2004. The old Kodak was way better than the new nikon!! Anyways, I ended up sending my Nikon L100 back after about 1.5 weeks, and spent a lot more money on a Canon DSLR, less portable, but take great pictures on command.

Reviews.Title: Its OK but not great
Reviews.Author: Dhananjay Bhoyar "DJ"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this camera recently and went to New Hampshire to shoot the beautiful foliage. The downloaded pictures on my computer does not look great as I expected from Nikon. It has no clarity so not sure if that 10MP is really working but portability is good, easy to handle and easy to click. Even my 6 yr old can operate it. But I am disappointed with the quality of the pictures so I am thinking of L90 now. Lets see..

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: M. DeJong
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and produces great photos.  I purchased it to use at my grandson's sporting events and it works great for those.  I love the wide angle zoom!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: Cesar A. Casillas "cesarin77"
Reviews.Content: Love the features, totally high def! Compact, easy to carry! Video recording y excellent! I really recommend this great camera! great if are recording or snapping pix in a sporting event where there is fast action, it captures great photos in the right setting! I love this Nikon! And so will you!

Reviews.Title: amazing!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: helen Murphy
Reviews.Content: This was best purchase ever!!!  I bought this for my husband for Father's day and was beyond shocked at how wonderful it was.  Even though it had a scratch( which seller fully stated), it did not hinder the performance at all.  It takes beautiful pictures and I will most definitely order from this seller again!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Versatile
Reviews.Author: Denis Faria
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with a great zoom lens. It is the best digital camera I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Rudi Niessen
Reviews.Content: it was well and nice package, arrived in good time and is being used, requirement where and sometime the box is way to big

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: MMG
Reviews.Content: We enjoy this camera very much.  The zoom range is almost as good as binoculars and have actually used the camera as binoculars when we have forgotten them on trips.  Have had this camera for a few years now and never have had a problem with it.  Good product.

Reviews.Title: Muy bien
Reviews.Author: Luis Israel Figueroa Peñalver
Reviews.Content: Buenas tardes, le comento que la camara nikon coolpix que compre esta en muy buen estado muchas gracias por todo

Reviews.Title: 4 yrs strong
Reviews.Author: Jessica Ryan "language aficionada"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for almost 4 yrs now & while I get frustrated with some aspects, overall it takes really good photos, you just have to know how to use it. Too many "pros" to name about the camera (including amazing photos. I get compliments now even though 1.) it is "only" 10.1 mp & 2.) we have all this new technology with cameras at many more megapixels!)Cons:Low light is probably the worst. Photos just do NOT come out without the flash. I have tried messing with the exposure compensation, but if you are not holding your camera perfectly still or the subject is not perfectly still, they will blur. Same goes for "moon" photos...will not work.Macro -- sometimes what you are trying to focus on is taken over by the autofocus and it focuses on whatever is BEHIND the thing you are TRYING to photograph. But once you learn to manipulate it, you can usually figure it out.Batteries -- I bought this camera to be able to use AA batteries...only to find out that the camera is super picky. It will not handle rechargeables (which was 90% of the reason I wanted to use AA!) and finding ones that will work in the camera without it automatically shutting off was a pain. Energizer, Duracell, top end batteries would not work. Get a cheap set at RiteAid and it loves them! Cannot figure that one out! But I found Fuji brand "throw-away-able" batteries (they will not harm the environment) at Big Lots pretty cheap and the camera loves them! So it is happy and so am I!Overall, I do adore this camera. I am potentially looking into upgrading just for the sake of upgrading to a better zoom, but cannot imagine actually getting RID of this camera. How many people can say that after almost four years?

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: PDP00
Reviews.Content: It works very well for me and I'm happy with it. The item was shipped very fast. I have to say I'm very pleased with this camera.I suggest this product. It's very good

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: cnelson91
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this purchase! It only cost a little over $100 for this used camera and it's great. I am not a professional photographer by any means, but this takes wonderful pictures without me doing much. I plan to learn a bit about photography so as to improve my photos even more. But overall, great camera, great price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ladonna L. Brummitt
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA IS LIKE NEW AND TAKES GREAT PICTURES..LOOKS JUST LIKE I EXPECTED..THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE GREAT CAMERA

Reviews.Title: One of the most amazing cameras!
Reviews.Author: justin
Reviews.Content: I was simply amazed by all the options this camera had. With the 15x optical zoom, everything is ultra clear. There is an easy auto mode, and an advanced mode which has the flash. This camera was amazingly light and very easy to set up. I would highly recommend buying this camera if you're looking for great quality.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Ntsuab Vaj
Reviews.Content: Maybe its just my camera but sometime it freezes, in order for me to fix it I have to take out the battery and stick them back in to stop the freezes.  Maybe its just my camera.  It gets irritating when you are gone a take the perfect picture.  Other then that this camera is the good for beginner Which is me.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Rainy
Reviews.Content: Camera came much earlier than expected, so my daughter was able to use it for her concert.She raved about it and loved the camera. Said it was the most amazing camera she had.  Pictures were very clear, even with the band members jumping up and down.  Exceptional service, A+ Seller.

Reviews.Title: Horrible image quality
Reviews.Author: Kelly Ingram
Reviews.Content: I've never hated a camera before.... until this one. How it ever got a good review I will never understand! The color quality is dull, the lens takes to long to focus, the flash is horrible, there are absolutely NO manual settings, and the pictures come out blurry almost everytime.  I use my phone camera over this one. There are to many pics of my kids that came out blurry for me to ever give this a good review.  Don't buy it....move on to the better one!

Reviews.Title: As an amatuer photographer pleased with it
Reviews.Author: robu
Reviews.Content: It works for what I use it for which is for indoor and outdoor shots for events and vacations. I've read a few reviews complaining about blurry pictures and I know what they're talking about. For me this mostly occurs in the Auto mode or many of the other still modes which is why I almost always use the Sports/Continuous mode. I will hold the button and take several continuous shots to ensure I get a good frame. It takes time sorting out and deleting some bad shots but oh well. I've gotten some really nice pictures from pro hockey games, concerts, ceremonies and parties where there is alot of movement. I haven't read the manual inside and out but I am also having a hard time getting night pictures or dark indoor pictures like concerts to turn out so far.

Reviews.Title: Fragile!
Reviews.Author: N. Suss "tazmex"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera when I bought it. However, after a few months, the flash stopped working and the zoom also. The plastic cap came loose. I was able to fix the zoom, but not the flash. It needs to be more durable!

Reviews.Title: Buying a different camera
Reviews.Author: Mertz
Reviews.Content: Today I purchased a Panasonic Lumix after a year and a half of frustration and disappointment using the Nikon Coolpix L100.  Not having an eye piece viewfinder is a BIG mistake as the sun reflects your own image off the monitor. Zoom in with the 15X lens and it is a guess if you are still on your subject using the monitor.  The viewfinder does not show the "refocus" using the image stabilization feature so another guess if the picture is going to turn out or not.  I gave up on this camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: RamenEATER
Reviews.Content: i luved this while i had it.  didnt use it much since i always have my blackberry with me....great camera though

Reviews.Title: The Great Outdoors with Nikon Coolpix L100
Reviews.Author: Banff4us
Reviews.Content: I have not used this camera extensively yet, however I have a few remarks.  I am a non-professional recreational photographer primarily shooting outdoors.  Nature scenes and landscapes.This camera was attractive because of its relatively light-weight and the 15X zoom for wildlife photography.  I have not used it yet for these purposes, so I intend to report back later on my experiences.What I can tell is this camera is very straight-forward to use.  The Easy-Shot mode will have most point and shoot photographers (like me) up and running quickly.  Easy to handle, has a nice feel.  The display is well designed, I haven't use it outside in daylight yet so not sure how well it handles glare.  Lot's of features for a reasonable price.  Works like a point-and-shoot digital with a little of the feel of a SLR.This camera works with NiMH rechargeable batteries if you desire.  One tip- after first installation of the NiMH batteries you change the battery selection (to NiMH), your battery meter will appear to be low.  Just turn off the camera and back on again, the low battery indication should disappear (if the batteries are fully charged).

Reviews.Title: Only one thing I hate about this camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: There are so many really wonderful features about this camera. It is also very easy to use.  Unfortunately, it has one big flaw - it takes terrible indoor shots.  More than half turn out with a yellow tint.  I have no other problems with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Not a Point and Shoot camera
Reviews.Author: M. Carpenter "Music Specialist"
Reviews.Content: I assumed that this was a point and shoot camera that looked like a D-SLR.It's not.  It's considered an entry level professional camera.I wish I would have known that before I purchased a Canon Rebel Eos.In my opinion, the L100 is far superior. The images are sharp and vibrant.  The price is very reasonable.If you're a beginner, this camera will make you look like a pro!

Reviews.Title: used camera
Reviews.Author: jrusse
Reviews.Content: I bought a used camera for the first time and was very skeptical about it but saw all the reviews and decided to go ahead and buy it. I love it! It was exactly what it appeared to be. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: LOOK BEFORE YOU LEAP -  CASUAL PICTURE TAKERS CAN GET THE NIKON L110 CHEAPER
Reviews.Author: Bill McLean "Serious Enjoyment"
Reviews.Content: You can get the improved Model L110 for a lower price.  It uses the same lens but has a 12MegaPixel sensor instead of 10.  Also, the image stabilizer is noticeably improved.  But I wouldn't recommend buying ether camera.  Both produce sharp images only in bright light where you get smaller lens opening (but larger numbered) f-stop settings.  The image quality is very poor if the lighting is much darker than a well lit store.  Also, they both lack direct user controls of ISO (light measurement method set by the International Organization of Standardization).  Neither camera is good in low light.  Results are fuzzy and grainy.###-SAME DAY UPDATE-###I'm changing my rating from ONE STAR to THREE STARS.  While all I have written above is true, the L100 does work well in ideal conditions.  And it does contain some miracles of our times. I think the lens is a bit too soft.  But the reason I don't rate it higher is because the L100 is way behind the competition.  (Checkout canon's line of small cameras.  The newer ones can be a bit pricey but they are a lot better than this Nikon.)I bought a Nikon L100 because of its size, portability, appearance, easy macro ability, and the extreme telephoto.  I didn't plan to reduce the use of my Single Lens Reflex (Canon Rebel 450D,T2i).  I just wanted a small camera only for some macro shots - and some long telephoto shots - with a camera that wont weigh me down.  The nearby discount store offered the L100 for $199.99.  At the time I thought that was a great price.  I trusted the Nikon brand name.  I should have checked the Internet reviews before buying any kind of camera.  I'm disappointed; but I can still get some use from this camera.  I'm not taking it back.While I want to agree with the ONE STAR reviewers, they must all be very serious amateurs.  No professional photographer would use such a camera - not in 2010.None the less, I now think that THREE STARS is more fair.  The L100 isn't really too awfully bad.  And the L110 is probably better.  Both are made for beginners and casual picture takers.  Such people might actually love the newer and lower priced Nikon 110.  It can take pictures that would have been impossible with a consumer digital camera ten years ago.  Yes, if this were the year 1900, I would give both cameras FOUR STARS.

Reviews.Title: a step up
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: This is a great step up from my last camera.  I was not ready for the digital SLR, and this was the perfect interim camera while I polish my photography skills.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100 Review
Reviews.Author: Katrina Abiasi
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for around a year now.  I use it for vacations and taking pictures of family mostly.  This camera will either be your best friend or your worst enemy depending on what your needs are.  A large LCD screen, easy to use controls, and an AMAZING 15x zoom will make your pictures turn out great if you want to use them for a family album.  If you are looking to get anything out of this camera besides family album pictures, you will be highly disappointed.  When enlarged (even on the 10mp mode) say to hang on a wall, etc. your pictures will look grainy beyond belief.  This won't be a problem for most people though.  Another negative is the bulky size of this camera...you have to make sacrifices though to get 15x zoom.  To conclude...if you are alright with taking around a camera case with you everywhere you want to take pictures and aren't going to enlarge or sell your photos...you will love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good!!
Reviews.Author: Gregorio Solis
Reviews.Content: This camera is giving me all I wanted from it, it's easy to use, great quality, and for beginners like me it helps a lot to get familiar with the photography stiles and everything.  It's a good thing to have.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Dash
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a Nikon because my previous Coolpix was so good, but I have been very disappointed with the photos I have taken with this camera.  Mostly, it is poor lighting...either the images are too hot if I use the flash, or too red if I use one of the low-light settings or the automatic settings.  I have few good pictures to show for this camera.  Also, it goes into power-save mode way too quickly and then by the time it wakes up, you've missed your shot.  More than once I have hit the power button instead of the shutter.  It's always something.  I'm planning to be much more careful about my next camera, which I plan to purchase soon, because this one just is not the right one for me.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Betsy Costa
Reviews.Content: I did alot of comparison shopping before I purchased this camera.  It is great!

Reviews.Title: rave review
Reviews.Author: Dale E. Christisen "toadccx"
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all aspects. This is exactly what I was looking for 100% satisfied with product & seller.

Reviews.Title: ist digital camera
Reviews.Author: BJ "cyber creep"
Reviews.Content: Being that this is my first digital camera after using a SLR for so many years it is great. I have used others before and I have found that this one is pretty easy to use except for I am still learning about some of the functions. I have found a little work on down loading and printing off of the disc, but over all out of 1 to 5 I would give this camera a 4.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Sunnycatshopper "Sunnycatshopper"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The zoom capability is amazing.  I got close up pictures from the back of an auditorium! The pics are clear.  The settings are great for the average photographer.  Nice camera, easy to sure.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Davola "valley queen"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Good for when you're "on the go" because of it's small size, but easy to hold.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: B. Peterson
Reviews.Content: Simply put...this camera is awesome. They only bad thing is that it is bulky and will not fit in pocket. But that is obvious when you look at it. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Choice
Reviews.Author: Nats
Reviews.Content: After researching cameras for what seemed like forever, I decided the Coolpix L100 fit my needs. I wanted high megapixels, strong optical zoom, and the ability to take pictures in rapid succession, but all within budget. I am constantly taking pictures, but I am in no way a professional. I would have loved to purchase a DSL camera, but I cannot justify the spend since I am just a novice. Hence my purchase of this Nikon. So far, I have been extremely pleased with the camera. I am quite amazed at the picture quality, but anything is an upgrade to my old 4MP camera. The Coolpix has more features than I know how to use, but I'm learning. I think this is a great purchase and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good non DSL digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I have used it for professionally done weddings and the pictures come out great. As for the focusing issues some people have been having, if you press the button half down the camera will focus and then you can take the picture clearly. It is highly beneficial to read the owner's manual to truly understand this camera. As for those who expect this to be a typical Point and Shoot, its not. Therefore this camera is not for someone looking for a camera to take pictures for them, its for someone who knows how to use the settings on the camera, and knows how to use a camera in general.I love this camera for the price, and the zoom works great. There are a ton of great settings on it as well, that are great for all different situations.

Reviews.Title: For the money
Reviews.Author: Learnin
Reviews.Content: I bought one a few weeks ago and for this **complete amateur** it's pretty darn good. There's some learning to do over my old Kodak that was even more basic. I've taken around 400 pics,most in auto mode,some with optical zoom,some flash,a basic variety I guess.Not all pics are perfect but I'm happy at this point. The software comes with a panorama program that has been interesting.Not sure but I think it is in the "bridge camera" catagory so after I get the functions down I may keep it for a backup and get a DSLR too.  For the money,so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Black "Pops"
Reviews.Content: This was a very good Christmas present.  The product shipped fast and was on time.  The camera is everything I thought it would be and more.  I would inform anyone that is in the market to buy a digital camera, this is the one.  Have a wonderful day.

Reviews.Title: Good Superzoom camera
Reviews.Author: Toivo
Reviews.Content: I have been using nikon cameras for many years and presently use a D200. My wife wanted a small camera to take family type snapshots when I didn't have my camera. She felt that the superzooms were what she needed and not a pocket camera. I researched the nikon, fuji, pentax and panasonic models. I have read many reviews saying nikon doesn't make good point and shot cameras and was a bit hesitant to buy this one. After ordering and using it for a couple months I can say I am happpy with it so far. The picture quality has been good. Battery life has been very good. Overall we have been happy with the camera. since it is winter we haven't taken a lot of outdoor shots with it yet. The only complaints we have are the lens cap must be removed to turn it on. You can't even review the phots on the card with the cap on. The second one is the flash doesn't pop up automatically when it is needed. In the program mode it should do this.  In general we have gotten use to it and like the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Butler "Barbara Butler-Hayes"
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting a camera for a long time. While I am not a novice, I am also not an expert using settings for a camera. I needed something that would automatically set and be easy to use. I researched for a while before deciding on this one. I am very happy with the way it works and in the way the photos turn out. Nikon has made it easy to be a good photographer with little experience. And it looks so good!!!!

Reviews.Title: CoolpixL100
Reviews.Author: Anna B "Go Heels"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I like the camera but I am not getting the quality shots I was expecting from the image stabilization.  I end up taking several and pick the best one.  Perhaps it is me.  I like the weight and all the features.  Perhaps with more experience, I will be able to stabilize the pictures more. Vendor shipped immediately.  I would do business with them again.

Reviews.Title: Cool pics with Coolpix!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Landino
Reviews.Content: Here's a camera that takes pictures like a professional. Different lighting situations, ability to adjust shutters speeds, the possibilities are almost endless. It comes with a generous neck-strap, so there are no worries about putting it down. The viewing screen is great without having to turn it a certain way to see it. The menu is fairly navigable, and the zoom is a breeze to work, leaving more thinking to go to the subject being photographed.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Santoyo
Reviews.Content: THE BETTER CHOICE IF YOU ARE LOOKINK FOR A NEW DIGITAL CAMERA WITH A GREAT ZOOM AND GREAT RESOLUTION ON IMAGE,ALSO GREAT QUALITY VIDEO AND SOUND.MY WIFE JUST LOVED IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Its worth buying
Reviews.Author: Anand Prakash "AP"
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty satisfied with this product.Before buying this product,I read review about this camera ,that we can't use Rechargeable battery with this Nikon coolpix camera BUT I tried rechargeable battery and it DOES work nice with that as well.So it's really nice camera,only thing is, it's flash light part doesn't come out automatically.Nikon Coolpix L100 10MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Consumer use
Reviews.Author: Ostate "Os"
Reviews.Content: This was a great buy for a christmas gift for my mother.  She has been using a 35mm disposable camera every year, so this was a great replacement.  Above and beyond anything she has ever had before.The image quality isn't perfect, as far as having a HD quality picture (I relate to video work I do), but for a consumer camera, you can't go wrong with it.  Really simple to use, it's small but has a large enough size that it doesn't get lost in your hands.

Reviews.Title: Nikon digital camera
Reviews.Author: William J. Bryden
Reviews.Content: excellent product great price. Does a lot more that I thpught and requires  learning time but I am sure it will be worth it.  I would recommend this product to  anyone who intends to move up to an SLR as this has most of the attribute of an SLR without the high price.  The camera was delivered exactely on the day it was promised.William Bryden

Reviews.Title: Nice Buy!
Reviews.Author: J. Wheeler "Teacher"
Reviews.Content: Great product. Great service.  I will definitely be a return shopper.JW

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Dennis Poletynski
Reviews.Content: If your comfortable with a point & shoot, but your ready to step up, this is the perfect camera for you. Simple to use, right out of the box, yet customizable enough to rival some digital SLR's, at half the size. Excellent image quality, allows for cropping & enlarging with very little pixelation. At under $200, I really didn't think this camera would be everything they said it was. I can honestly say it has exceeded my expectations, and I'm still learning all the features.

Reviews.Title: Excellent next-level camera
Reviews.Author: Jairo Lopez
Reviews.Content: I wanted a next-level camera from a normal point-and-shoot camera, and the Nikon L100 is great at that. Got my camera before a trip to Europe, and after reading the reviews, comments and the manual, I got amazing pictures from my trip. Definitively a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100
Reviews.Author: KCJ
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. No complaints or concerns product quality or dependability at this time.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Boynes "Sci-Fi/Horror lover, going through...
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a gift and the camera received raves for the pics it takes and the easy of use. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Harry
Reviews.Author: Charalampos Polymilis "maverick"
Reviews.Content: Very good in use and portability. The only minor thing is that the battery is going out too fast. It last only for 200-250 photos.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price
Reviews.Author: Suvrajit Sengupta
Reviews.Content: I am no photography connoisseur so I don't know how helpful this review will be.... But its good value for money.  The screen size is large (something I was looking for), and the lens size is adequate for people who just take photographs on trips etc.  I like the white balance feature, it helps to capture images in proper color in all lighting conditions, so your pictures don't come out looking orangish when you are taking photos indoors at night, for instance at parties and what not.  Flash is powerful.  I also like that it takes AA batteries, so in case you run out of batteries you can always buy some batteries.... though it takes 4 AA batteries.... The 'Easy Auto' mode is pretty good, and in most cases you won't have to worry about tinkering with the settings.... However, its better to know about a few settings and use the camera in the 'Auto' mode instead.  The preloaded settings for portrait/scenary etc etc are also pretty good.  I haven't tested out the image stabilization or the 'best picture' or 'sports' modes either, but I think they will be pretty useful for taking photographs of moving objects.  Overall I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: L100 Does Not Have Fireworks Mode
Reviews.Author: Mrs. A
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon on Thanksgiving evening, on a Black Friday special. I am happy with it, but I do have two complaints.CONS: First, Nikon did not include Fireworks in the mode on this camera.  I called Nikon, and was informed by a representative that the camera DOES have fireworks. She had me go online and right there with my own eyes I saw that Nikon's Tech Specs showed that this camera included Fireworks.  I loved the Fireworks mode on my Nikon Coolpix S550 and took some amazing fireworks photos (using a small tripod).  But the L100's user manual makes no mention of fireworks, and the camera does NOT include fireworks.  Nikon would not call me back, even though the rep elevated the call to Level 2. I then tried contacting them online.  I included a screenshot of the Tech Specs from their site along with asking if there was a way to upgrade the firmware to include fireworks. They closed my case and never contacted me.  Next thing I know, Nikon's website has removed fireworks from the Tech Specs.  Great customer service, Nikon. NOT.  The other complaint, of lesser importance is I wish the L100 had the 2 second timer which I miss (my Nikon Coolpix S550 had it). It is great to take eBay photos. I don't need 10 whole seconds for things like that. I really can't believe that Nikon is going to ignore me. I will definitely rethink ever investing in another Nikon camera.Almost every review I found on the Internet states that the camera has fireworks. I'm sure this is because they copied Nikon's original erroneous description word for word.  It is frustrating because how are you supposed to trust a company that says one thing and does another?  I'm sure somebody just made a mistake and put fireworks into the Tech Specs. But the camera has been out for many months, maybe even as long as a year and no one caught it?  Now that I've brought it to their attention, they are trying to cover up and pretend it never happened. Shame, Nikon.  At the VERY least you could have called me back, thanked me for bringing the mistake to your attention and apologized profusely.This camera DOES TAKE RECHARGEABLES batteries, contrary to reviews stating the opposite. Nikon put together firmware so the camera can be upgraded to accept rechargeables. This is a sweet upgrade, and I wish they would do the same with the fireworks and the 2 second timer. If you buy a camera today, it should already be upgraded so that it WILL TAKE RRechargeable Ni-MH Battery EN-MH2.PROS: I like the handgrip (although I am having to learn to place my thumb differently as I keep pressing view accidentally). I love the zoom capacity. I have been able to get some AWESOME shots of the full moon. You do have to be in telephoto zoom in order to get clear shots *AND* use a tripod to stabilize.  Speaking of the image stabilizing - it is excellent. Last year I took Santa photos for my job using my Nikon Coolpix S550 and had to use a tripod to get really good pictures. This year I brought my tripod, but ended up taking many shots freehand. The camera performed wonderfully.  Hardly any blurry photos. I like that it doesn't flash unless you open the flash door. This makes it so much quicker to take photos without flash. Just don't open the flash door!  On the other hand, if the scene does require the flash, it won't work without remembering to open the flash door. Nice big monitor and lens. The camera makes me look like I paid a lot more for it.  There was also the learning curve to remember to TAKE the LENS CAP off BEFORE turning on the camera, or the dreaded "lens error" appeared. However, turning the camera off and back on it goes away.All in all I'm happy with this camera; although my trust in Nikon has been knocked down several notches.I upgraded to this camera because my Nikon Coolpix S550 started getting lens errors which seemed to be directly related to the battery/SD card door not closing properly. The door closing issue got worse the longer I owned the camera, although I was very careful to close the door properly. The S550 lasted just 17 months and is now too unreliable to continue to use. I hope the L100 has a longer life.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Nan Krajewski
Reviews.Content: I bought it as it was in 2 day delivery pack. The body of the camera is very comfortable to carry and to hold while taking the photo, has curved places for fingers on both sides. Batteries are fitted in the corner with the slot for the memory card (SD card). Very big screen LCD screen where you can see more details. I was surprised that the camera supports my language as English is not my native. The only thing missing is viewfinder but this is only my opinion. This camera will be perfect for beginners!

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Erin Nicole
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon a few months ago & love it so far! I'm by no means a professional photographer, but I do take TONS of pictures. This is my 3rd digital camera. First was a Canon that I had some major problems with after less than 2 years, had to send it off to be fixed then it broke again & I finally ended up buying a Sony. I've had the Sony about 2.5 years & have had no problems w/ it. I still like it for every day stuff (it's small & fits in my purse), but I really wanted a camera w/ more zoom & this Nikon is perfect.I went to Hawaii shortly after I bought the camera & it's very easy to use. I learned all the features quickly w/out reading the manual. I took it everywhere, took about 500 pics & they all came out great. My friend who lives there loved it & says it's better than her SLR. I got some wonderful pics of her kids on the beach using the "beach" setting. I also got great sunset pics w/ the "sunset & dusk/dawn" settings. The indoor pictures turn out great as well...the color is very nice.The camera is not heavy, very comfortable to wear around your neck w/ the strap. I wish it would've come w/ a case, couldn't even find one through Nikon. I ended up buying a Sony case from Walmart & it fits perfectly.This is a great camera for someone who wants something a little more professional than a point & shoot, but doesn't want the price or size of a SLR. When my friends see the lens on this thing, they think it's really expensive & cannot believe I got it at Amazon for just over $200. Amazon definitely has the best price since you don't pay shipping or tax. I did a lot of research & couldn't decide what brand is best...I think you never really know what can happen w/ electronics. But I love this Nikon & would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Mckenize Chamberlain
Reviews.Content: After some research I ended up buying the Nikon Coolpix L100. Overall I'm very pleased. The picture quality has been great. I take a lot of pictures of moving animals, and it can keep up. I was even able to use the sports mode to take pictures of hummingbirds. I'm not super camera savvy and this camera is easy for me to navigate. The menu and options are easy to use. I do have a couple complaints. I think it's nuts that you HAVE to take the lense cap off to even turn on the camera. Which means you have to take off the lense cap even if your not taking pictures and just wanted to view them. I've also had a little bit of problems taking indoor photographs. After many trial pictures I think I've got it figured out, but the quality isn't as good as outdoors. For the most part the auto mode works with what i'm using it for, but every once in a while I'll have to change the setting or brightness to get the picture to turn out. But over all I'm extremely happy with it, it's a major step up from my last camera and is a very easy point and shoot camera. It makes me feel like i'm a better photographer than I really am!

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: R. M. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: i think is the better camera for simple use,you dont need more for excellent pictures ita perfect for travels, weekend or a funny celebration

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100 Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Manly "Car Man"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera, the wide angle lense and zoom are great. This camera is a little more complicated than your average point and shoot but if you take the time to read the manual and do a little practice shooting you can get some very good pictures.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Susan J. Olson "oldfolkiemom"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that gave me great close up images. That is why I searched for a 15x zoom. I read people's reviews and many were very pleased with the camera as a whole. So I plunked down the nearly two hundred bucks for it. When I got home and excitedly began shooting pix, the pix looked horrible. Everything I took in the zoom mode was blurry. The pix weren't crisp and clear, and everything seems to have a yellow tinge to it. Plus, the time between pressing the shutter button to when it actually takes the pic is too long. By the time the pic is taken, the people or animals have already moved and your picture is crap. I can't figure out what planet these people are from who gave this a good rating, because I am totally bummed about it. I bought mine at Target, so I'm stuck with it. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: first time user of a Nikon cameral
Reviews.Author: The Family History Gal "The family history gal"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I can really zoom with this camera.  It is easy to use.  I am still learning how to do alot of things with the camera.  The only thing I am not happy about is that you can not charge the batteries. M.N.

Reviews.Title: good SLR value
Reviews.Author: J. H. Page
Reviews.Content: this is the best lens/slr combo for the price, very happy with the images, versatile.  Battery consumption is only issue.

Reviews.Title: Excelentisimo
Reviews.Author: Diegol
Reviews.Content: Muy buenas fotos, aunque la calidad del video es baja, pero es para fotos así es que no hay problema; excelente resolución, estabilidad y todo; recontra buena.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera
Reviews.Author: Patty Gemmill
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I purchased this camera in spite of a few bad reviews. Very easy to use and very good picture quality, thebatteries that came with it lasted no time at all so I did purchase Energizer ultimate lithium batteries and have been using the camera daily for over a month.I have not even tried all the options yet as I have not needed them, auto mode is fine for now. As always Amazon had the best price and the best customer service !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Lotus "Lotus"
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer but I enjoy doing art photography and this camera is the right thing for me. Sofar I have not had any complains with it. I am happy. Maybe if one day I need to take very professional pictures I will think on something more in that direction . Bt for now it works perfectly for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: L. Robbins
Reviews.Content: This camera is very cool.  I teach in an inner city elementary school so my students come in a wide variety of colors.  I am very happy with the way this camera automatically adjusts so that every student looks great in their photo. It is easy to print out the photos.  I have only had the camera for a month, but I am really enjoying it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great First Advanced Jump in Zoom In
Reviews.Author: K. Bergeron "Marine"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L100 10MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) ZoomFor those that are ready to step up to a greater zoom but unable to pay for a single lense reflex camera this camera is a great start and worth the money.  I recommend however that you read the guide that comes with it as you investigate all the features.  If you follow the directions it will turn out OK.  My experience with Amazon.Com for any NEW products has been EXCELLENT.  I recommend that you stick with NEW and "not used" items.This Nikon point-and-shoot is absolutely great preparing you to use features that you will find in good and more expensive cameras.

Reviews.Title: hate it
Reviews.Author: Jungle Jim
Reviews.Content: Received the camera Dec 14. Set it up, took some shots and did not like it at all.So ..... looked at reviews here, studied the book and took the camera on an 8 dayXmas cruise. Took 102 shots - inside, outside, action, portraits, etc. End result is I still do not like the camera. A few of the portraits are right on but manyshots have a grainy look to them. Out of focus? Perhaps but some are OK and others are not. Why? My previous 8 year old camera was pretty beat up from use but wasconsistent and took crystal clear shots. The L100 is my first Nikon and verydisappointing. I expected much more.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Carla Hashley "C Hash"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I got it a few days before I left for Europe so with out much time to learn about it or practice on it I was amazed by how easy it is to us, the quality of photo it does, the options it gives you and how much fun it is. The different models it offers and the easy first one is amazing and there are very few photos that I didn't like because of the fault of the camera. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great camera, looking to move up in the quality of photos, or looking to grow in skill is it's a great camera to learn on.

Reviews.Title: I want to trash it
Reviews.Author: Ray Zhang
Reviews.Content: I have bought the camera for more than one year. It is the first time that I post the negative comment one the product. When I just bought it, I liked the zoom and wide angle, but I found the poor quality of indoor picture, it is much worse than my very old canon card digital camera. Even the outdoor pictures are not good either when compared with the sony card camera of my girlfriend. I do not know why nikkon produce such product. I keeps me away from nikkon's other products when I think about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100
Reviews.Author: Froggie52
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my New Years cruise to the Bahamas with my Daughter (my Kodak Easy Share died).  I had her use it on the cruise as she is more gadget savy than I.  The pictures came out great.  The only problem I've had was that it froze about 5 minutes on 2 separate occasions causing me to miss some good photo ops.  I can't figure what I did to cause that to happen.  I love the fact that it uses AA batteries.  No waiting for the battery to recharge.  Love the features and it has a great look.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great but it ain't no point and shoot
Reviews.Author: K. Anthony
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews on this camera before I bought it.  Seemed there were some early learning experiances but overall was easy to use and took great pictures.  Well, I have taken 140 shots so far and half of them do not come out clear.  If you are inside, the picture quality is fair at best.  You have to change the mega pixel down to around 4 to get clear inside shots.  If you are going to use the zoom, change the mega pixel down to around 3.  The stabilization does not work all that great either.  I am going to spend another couple of weeks with this thing and if it continues to take all kinds of adjustments to get decent picture I am sending it back.  This thing is alittle more like a SLR when it comes to taking pictures, ain't no point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good price; good camera
Reviews.Author: K. Fuller
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price.  Simple to use and understand the various options you have.  Creates good looking pictures.

Reviews.Title: digital camera review
Reviews.Author: Betty C. Luker
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for the cost. Would recommend it to anyone. Very easy to transfet to computer.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100
Reviews.Author: James M. Dodson
Reviews.Content: Excellent product and results.  It takes awhile for a novice like me to learn the various functions and how to execute their commands but it's amazing what this small camera's capabilities are; particularly considering the price range.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L100 review
Reviews.Author: Dennis J. Steciw "bargain finder"
Reviews.Content: The camera is a very good buy and it is very easy to use> I received the camera very quickly.

Reviews.Title: A decent camera for a budget
Reviews.Author: J. Templeton "Lazerguppie"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and chose it myself. I was looking at purchasing a Kodak Z1015 iS, but could not find a place where I could actually get my hands on it. This camera was purchased to replace a FANTASTIC, but old and slowly dying Kodak DX 7630.While the camera takes very sharply focused pictures when they are in focus, I am having trouble finding the sweet spot. The colors (especially reds and oranges) are overly saturated and I usually have to edit them by hand. The flash is WAY TOO BRIGHT and I am considering taping some tissue over it to tone it down since I have not found a way to change the brightness in the menu. The buttons are very sensitive and I am constantly hitting them on accident whilst holding the camera.Any average tech savvy person can operate this camera right out of the box. It is very easy to use. I have played with most of the Auto and Manual settings and am pleased for the most part.I still would have liked to get  that Kodak in my hands....still trying to decide if I am going to return this L100.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price, but the power should have been rechargeable battery, instead regular.
Reviews.Author: M. U. Ahmed "MansurMN"
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the price, but the power source should be rechargeable battery, instead regular. Otherwise I'm damn satisfied with the product and it's functionality.

Reviews.Title: did not work well
Reviews.Author: Vladimir S. Yakopson
Reviews.Content: Maybe I had a defective one, but the pictures were mostly not sharp. The sports shooting mode was cool but the main photos were just not great. I have 2 kids and I wanted to take better pictures of them, but every time they moved (and kids do that you know) I'd get a blurry photo. I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: T. Robertson "check and mate"
Reviews.Content: Still learning.  A bit more than point and shoot.  50% blurry pictures on XMAS day.  Probably need to read the directions, LOL.

Reviews.Title: Agreed It really it did not work at all
Reviews.Author: Bills
Reviews.Content: This is camera is going back to the shop. I have bought after reading so many good review and getting optical and digital for a price. However for some reason picture are not clear...most of the times pictures are blurred. I think pictures are blurred because of slight movement and/or not propering focusing even in an auto mode. I have two kids and this is a big issue, I am not sure what I am missing and why there are so many good reviews for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Spare Camera
Reviews.Author: Silver Dragon
Reviews.Content: This is a rather simple little camera. The photographs it produces are of decent quality and can be edited for a website or poster. It doesn't do particularly well on action shots, though.It runs on four AA batteries, which I see as a demerit, but apparently there are people who like cameras that run on alkalines.The main screw up that happened with this camera was when I flipped it on one day and found that every single photo, even the locked ones, on the memory card had somehow been deleted. I most definitely did not delete them myself, and the memory card had not been tampered with. I would be much more upset about this if I hadn't downloaded the photos to my computer the night before (no, the computer didn't delete them: they were still there when I checked after the downloading).It's a good spare camera, and nothing more.

Reviews.Title: A very awful camera.
Reviews.Author: Maria Chernaya "gemnastka"
Reviews.Content: You think this is a good camera when you look at its features and it feels like everybody who gave it a bad review just didn't know how to use the camera. I played around with the camera a lot, read the manual, and the picture quality is just always bad no matter what you do. I think my phone camera and the cheapest digital camera can take better photos. Don't waste your money on this camera!

Reviews.Title: Bad image quality
Reviews.Author: Shauvik Roy Choudhary
Reviews.Content: I have used sony and canon cameras all my life. This was the first Nikon camera i got. Picture quality isn't as great as others although some features seem to be neat.

Reviews.Title: Its got the focussing problem
Reviews.Author: xgalaxy "xgalaxy"
Reviews.Content: I got very excited when I purchased this camera thinking that it could be a great replacement for a point and shoot type cameras and also to have a feeling like SLR. May be not. This camera was not focusing the image at all. Also its making a hushing noise while focussing the image in zoom mode. I thought I am making a mistake. So I went to best buy and fooled around with the same model camera out there on display. It was working perfectly fine with very very fast capturing and dead silent. I tried to take an image for the tiny screw on my eye glasses frame and it took a crystal clear picture in no time. So I concluded definitely the piece I got is defective. Amazon is great but I was hesitant to take a replacement option becuase the whole lot they have could be bad ones. But thank you Amazon for giving me the credit on returns. So final word, camera could be a great one but reliability is doubtful. Take a chance if you really like it.

Reviews.Title: The coolest...
Reviews.Author: J. Morales
Reviews.Content: Just the best digital camera I ever bought. Talk about clear pictures and so easy to use, good going Nikon great product...

Reviews.Title: I sent it back
Reviews.Author: Ted Honghiran
Reviews.Content: I bought the nikon coolpix L100 after read the reviews which most of them very happy with the photo but after I use it for a week,I am very disappointed because most the photo came out blurr especially indoor shot.So I sent it back and order the canon sx200 ibstead.I should stay with canon like one of the reviewer said. ted

Reviews.Title: DON"T BUY THIS CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: Vlad N. "Vlad"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a trip to Antarctica (very bright light). My Canon powershot 120 got a speck on the inside lens so I needed a replacement.  I went out and re-took a few pictures thinking I would have them in better quality.  NOT EVEN CLOSE!  This flaming pile of crap overexposed nearly all of them.  I went out and did some comparison shooting between the Canon and this one and the Canon did not overexpose a single shot.  I don't think the shutter speed even exceeds 1000 on this thing.  Also, it is noticeably slower to start up.  The lens quality is slightly better but not at all a redeeming quality.  If you want a decent point-and-shoot go with the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problem
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Wolf "Wolfie"
Reviews.Content: Someone please help me out. As part of my order for the new Nikon L100 camera I also ordered a charger and rechargeable AA batteries. After receiving the camera the User's manual is telling me that rechargeable batteries cannot be used. As part of the L100 camera packages available on Amazon rechargable batteries are included. Can I or can I not use the rechargeable batteries that are being sold with this camera?

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Susan & Sam
Reviews.Content: IT's OK but just OK. WE had another digital camera and it was much better. The software that came with this one was awful. If We could exchange it we would. The better software was offered for sale but after seeing the free stuff I did not purchase it. WE did not purchase any accessories. I also did not like the quality of the photographs. But thay may just be getting to know the camera. All in all it's just OK.

Reviews.Title: For snapshots only
Reviews.Author: Tom Fulery
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the SLR design & the nice lens. This camera is strictly for those who don't know or care anything about photography. It's all automatic, and any creative control must be programmed by menus. The lens is not even threaded for filters so you can't even use a basic UV lens protector. Considering all that it doesn't do, this camera is a bulky pocket rock, and those for whom it was designed would be better off with a compact point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L100
Reviews.Author: Chung H. Yen
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera in 4/6/09,I love very much but only one month after ,this one is dead.I do not know what happened,now I send back to Nikon see what are they said.I hope they can fix it.In 5/18/09 I am going to vacation for three weeks,I know this is the vacation without viewing.  Chung Yen
